title: GROOVY-8983: STC: support "Type[] array = collectionOfTypeOrSubtype"
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GROOVY-8983

**NOTE:** `GenericsUtils.parameterizeType("List<? super Type>","Collection")` returns `Collection<Type>` and not `Collection<? super Type>`.  I attempted to address this, but was not successful.  This should probably be fixed at some point because it breaks the semantics of "? super Type".

title: GROOVY-9993: clarify boundary cases for split property definition (field and property of same name)
body: When defining a property, getters and setters are automatically supplied unless an existing one is found. This same rule also applies to the backing field but to date many aspects of this rule have been under specified, e.g. what happens if the type given for the field and property aren't the same? This PR clarifies these edge cases and provides a more formal definition of the behavior (the different types mentioned earlier for example becomes a compiler error).

title: GROOVY-9397: Make respondsTo thread safe
body:
Because ClosureMetaClass.loadsMetaInfo() changes the initialized state 
of the Closure's Metaclass without any locking, if the Closure is visible to
another thread, then any call to invokeMethod can see the closure as
uninitialized and throw an exception.

This fix removes the need to change the initialized state of the
closure in loadMetaInfo().

title: GROOVY-9807: limit receiver replacement for implicit-this in inner class
body:
When user creates a method call expression, the default is for implicit
this to be true and this has caused a number of problems for transforms
when applied to inner class scenarios.  Only when the object expression
is truly "this" should it be rewritten to "Outer.this" when referencing
an outer class method.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GROOVY-9807

title: GROOVY-9954: Stop incrementing index after comments to avoid skipping…
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GROOVY-9954

Stopped incrementing index in handleComment() and handleBashComment().
These are called in three places.
In decodeJsonObjectLax(), the index is incremented by the for-loop, but startIndexOfKey needs to be set to the next character after the comment.
In decodeValueInternal(), the index is incremented by the for-loop.
In decodeJsonArrayLax(), the index is not incremented by the do-while-loop, it needs to be manually incremented.

title: GROOVY-9945: findParameterizedType: fill type parameters of super types
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GROOVY-9945

There is quite a history to `findParameterizedType` and related methods.  I did not fully understand the reason for some of the looser checks.  I think they were to account for incomplete generics, which are now more complete.  Rather then building the whole type hierarchy at once, I took an approach of build as needed.  This should reduce some of the cost of searching.  I would have reduced the method count further, but it's all public api now.

title: GROOVY-9932: Fix callCurrent invocation on MockProxyMetaClass
body:
Fix [GROOVY-9932](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GROOVY-9932): Implement new signature of `ProxyMetaClass#invokeMethod` added by 34ad466ba6a87a5eb26cf4a444f817299b744edb.

I'm not sure if this is intended to be a supported usage. You can reject this if it isn't. But it worked in Groovy 2.4, and it looks easy enough to make it work again.

title: Make Gradle build fully cacheable
body:
As a new hire in Gradle, part of my onboarding has been updating the build of an OSS project to be fully cacheable and we've chosen Groovy for this purpose. Also, the Gradle wrapper and the Gradle Enterprise plug-in have been upgraded to the latest released version. 

Please, have a look at my proposed changes, and merge them if you agree with them. :)

title: GROOVY-9681: apply GROOVY-9515 patch to v7.IndyInterface
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GROOVY-9681

This is a lite version of https://github.com/apache/groovy/pull/1227/files#diff-346370ec8511baf4e07e2c5fd7604a9d163d05d107f3baa4ae2f7809e8e6c759 targeted at 3_0_X specifically (v7.IndyInterface does not exist in master).  The test case is a bit difficult to set up since it requires _indy_ compilation that links to v7.IndyInterface (the Groovy 2.5 part of GROOVY-9681) and execution under Groovy 3.

I am trying this test under Groovy 4 now to see if it needs anything...

title: STC: normalize inclusion of types in errors
body:
"Cannot call \<T> java.util.List#leftShift(T) ..."
  was
"Cannot call \<T> java.util.List \<String>#leftShift(T) ..."

Arrays are displayed as "java.lang.String[]" not "[Ljava.lang.String;"

title: GROOVY-9890: always search for default methods
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GROOVY-9890
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GROOVY-7160

Test for GROOVY-7160 is now located here: https://github.com/apache/groovy/blob/292254523545a1ab04e85f31ff4f82de417b0ac7/src/test/groovy/transform/stc/BugsSTCTest.groovy#L681

Selection between `EnumSet.of(Enum,Enum[])` and `Set.of(Object,Object,Object,Object,Object,Object)` is consistent between dynamic and static modes.

title: last() method for LinkedList can be more efficient
body: A LinkedList has a method called getLast() which on a DoublyLinkedList is a direct reference. Using size and get() can take more overhead in testing. While this optimization is VERY small, it can have impacts on large list traversals

repo.name: groovy
repo.description: Apache Groovy: A powerful multi-faceted programming language for the JVM platform

title: GROOVY-9892: fix operand stack for ++x / x++ in static compilation
body:
40ee3fd0c19530b4308c7c1b3e30abd4d45ed54a replaced an invocation of
`ScriptBytecodeAdapter.setGroovyObjectProperty()` into an invocation of
the generated `pfaccess$0*` mutator method.
Contrary to `setGroovyObjectProperty()`, the mutator method has a return
value, which ends up pushed to the operand stack.

This commit discards the value being pushed to the stack by pop'ing it.

title: GroovyClassLoader fileReallyExists super inefficient
body: fileReallyExists was doing a case sensitive test by listing all files in the directory. this is heavy on the filesystem API and can be done with simply using getCanonicalPath comparison.

title: GROOVY-9877: Add DGM `asReversed` to `List`
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GROOVY-9877

Though we have DGM `list.reverse()` already, it will create a new list containing all elements from the original list.
While the proposed `list.asReversed()` will create a view list, which just delegates method calls to the original list.
